page.title: 12FARMING IN STURTON & AREA
page.content: THE AREA IS MAINLY ARABLE WITH WINTER SOWN CROPS OF{WHEAT,BARLEY,OILSEED {RAPE AND SOME OATS.}SMALL ACREAGES OF {SUGAR BEET,POTATOES,PEAS,BEANS AND {MANGOLDS}ARE USED AS BREAK CROPS. SOME LAND IS USED FOR{HORTICULTURE}AT BROXHOLME,WHERE TREES,SHRUBS & PLANTS ARE GROWN FOR RETAIL.THE REMAINING ACREAGE IS USED FOR{GRAZING}SHEEP,BEEF AND DAIRY CATTLE,ALSO{HAY AND SILAGE MAKING. BIG BAG SILAGE IS BECOMING INCREASINGLY POPULAR. INCREASED {MECHANISATION}HAS REDUCED THE LABOUR FORCE ON THE LAND. AN AVERAGE ARABLE FARM OF 4OO ACRES IS WORKED BY 3 MEN USING 4 WHEELED DRIVE TRACTORS, RANGING FROM 16-325 H.P. YIELDS AND PRICES PER ACRE ARE:-{WHEAT}65CWT @ Â£1OO PER TONNE;{BARLEY}55CWT @ Â£9O PER TONNE;{RAPE }25CWT @ Â£28O PER TONNE. THERE ARE 3 INTENSIVE{PIG-KEEPING UNITS IN THE AREA.
